column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=5 .
#Text=Proof of Concept and Validation
#Text=In order to test the capabilities of the system , it has been subjected to several tests .
#Text=First , the system has been tested with a large number of incoming threats , being capable of analyzing each one in an average time of 0.01 s.
#Text=Then , the system was also tested with threats from more than one source of information , some with a high degree of confidence and others with a very low level .
#Text=At the end of each analysis , a JSON document with the results is generated .
#Text=An example of this kind of document is shown in
#Text=Figure 9
#Text=.

#Text=Here , 126 threats were analyzed , which came from sources of information with a high level of confidence , and therefore , all of them were influenced by the confidence assigned to that source .

#Text=As can be seen , there is a considerable difference between the general risk for Spain ( riskSpain ) and the risk when taking into account the history of attacks , that is , the memory of the system related to how old the attacks are by applying equation 5 ( riskSpainWithMemory ) .
#Text=If this situation were maintained over time , the risk with memory would end up converging with the instantaneous risk .
#Text=In addition , the risk within an AC , i. e. , Andalusia , is calculated based on 48 threats , both with and without memory .
#Text=In order to simplify the visualization of the data produced by the system , a graphical interface was implemented by using Java ’s library JFreeChart .
#Text=Figure 10
#Text=shows the history of the general risk in Spain , both with memory and the instantaneous one .
#Text=As can be observed , the risk with memory tends to follow the trend of the instantaneous , but if the variations are very fast , it tends to represent the average of these .
#Text=The strongest peaks of memory risk are due to the fact that certain measurements are composed of a large number of threats and , therefore , great representativeness .
#Text=The history described in
#Text=Figure 10
#Text=is composed of 36 risk measurements , each generated with a range of threat events from 100 to 500 .
#Text=Each threat event has been compounded by its geographic location , IP , a timestamp , severity index , the event confidence , name of the detected threat , etc.
#Text=The threats simulated were balanced in terms of impact level and confidence in the source of information .
#Text=This is why the instantaneous trend , represented by the red line , has such pronounced peaks .
#Text=The system also provides the analyst with a detailed asset histogram , which can be grouped by a specific AC , as
#Text=Figure 11
#Text=shows .
#Text=Finally , the risk in real-time can also be observed .
#Text=In this sense ,
#Text=Figure 12
#Text=shows the risk in real-time as measurements are produced .
